metadata.title: CVE-2023-39417 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
IN THE EXTENSION SCRIPT, a SQL Injection vulnerability was found inPostgreSQL if it uses @extowner@, @extschema@, or @extschema:...@ inside aquoting construct (dollar quoting, '', or ""). If an administrator hasinstalled files of a vulnerable, trusted, non-bundled extension, anattacker with database-level CREATE privilege can execute arbitrary code asthe bootstrap superuser.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-39417` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libecpg-compat3 - 14.9-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libecpg6 - 14.9-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libpgtypes3 - 14.9-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libpq5 - 14.9-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
postgresql-14 - 14.9-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
postgresql-client-14 - 14.9-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
postgresql-plperl-14 - 14.9-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
postgresql-plpython3-14 - 14.9-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
postgresql-pltcl-14 - 14.9-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: postgresql-14 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '14.9-0ubuntu0.22.04.1').
